description.narrative: (i) Food security. The Project will have significant contribution to efficient use of farm land and higher productivity through supply of four wheel tractors that offer higher technology and horsepower by manufacturing close to 200,000 tractors and reaching that many farmers during the life of the IFC loan. (ii) Development of downstream food industry. Higher crop output resulting from large scale farming with four-wheel tractors will help develop downstream industries such as food processing and packaging. (iii) Inclusive business. The Project will help the development of SMEs along the value chain, including the dealers/distributors, suppliers, logistics and service providers. A significant portion of these SMEs, especially the distributors, are based in frontier regions and rural areas. (iv) Job creation. The Project is expected to create more 700 direct jobs in its facilities, as well as significant level of indirect jobs along the value chain and downstream industries.

IFC proposes to provide a loan up to Euro 10 million (approx. US$13 million) to support Shandong Changlin Deutz-Fahr Machinery Co., Ltd. (Changlin-SDF) to build a greenfield plant in Shandong province to manufacture four-wheel tractors in China. Changlin-SDF is a joint venture established by Same Deutz-Fahr Group SpA (SDF), an Italian agri-machinery manufacturer and Shandong Changlin Machinery Group Co., Ltd (Changlin Group), a Chinese machinery manufacturer in July 2011.
